Reviews.Title: “won't get what you paid for!”
Reviews.Author: Lambano1
Reviews.Content: I booked and paid for my room online before I went overseas and the room description specifically said "king size bed". What I got were two small single roll-out beds pushed together that kept moving apart when you're on one of them. When I brought this up at reception, they were not only unhelpful, they were rude and very abrupt. They changed my room but the beds were the same. The staff in general were very unfriendly and unhelpful in all areas - including the housekeeping. The rooms were also dirty and the linen looked used. The toiletries such as shampoo and conditioner in the bathroom were half used, and when I requested new ones repeatedly, none ever came. The hotel is definitely located in a very inconvenient spot and too far from the city. For what you have to pay for transport into the city, it is not worth staying at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Way too far from city center”
Reviews.Author: Shelly G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely far from any city sights or reliable public transportation. Once you get here they charge you for a shuttle service that claims to take you to "Rome City Center" but it takes you to Piazza Risorgimento which is in the Vatican area of Rome. The wireless internet is ridiculously expensive 72 euro for a 7 day stay or 10.80 euro per day. This hotel is misguiding in regards to amenities and location, my advice the money you may save from staying here will be spent in transportation and utter frustration, so just pay a little more and stay at a closer hotel. The rooms are nice, but if you are here to see Rome, this isn't the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice room! Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: AR-BRAY
Reviews.Content: The room was clean. THe bathroom was great. The tub was very deep, good for a soak after walking all day! The staff speaks English and are friendly. The bed was the most comfortable of all the hotels (4) that I stayed in while in Italy. The restaurant was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Not welcome here!”
Reviews.Author: Jack37069 Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and proceeded to the front desk to check in. All seemed very normal with activity that seemed to indicated any problems. When I told the person behind the desk who we were she looked in the computer and then stepped away. I saw her whisper to the manager while pointing to us. I knew we were in trouble. The manager comes overs and starts with the word "Unfortunately!" He continued some story about water in our rooms and that were could not stay. They had booked us into rooms at a close by hotel and that we needed to go there. I asked if they were not going to take us since we had come by taxi. "No, it is very close by, only behind those trees" So here we go, three of us with luggage walking on some road looking as lost as last year's Easter Egg. We had to walk several hundred yards up a very steep hill to the new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, FAR from City Center”
Reviews.Author: alex l
Reviews.Content: Our room was one of the renovated rooms and it was very nice, but the hotel was way too far from the Rome city center. There is a bus down the hill that you can take to the metro, but overall it is almost 45 minutes to the center of Rome. We did not take advantage of the shuttle as it didnt leave until 9:45 and the last shuttle came back at 6:00. The hill the hotel is on is also steep and difficult to walk to from the bus station. There is a grocery store at the bottom of the hill which was very nice. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone trying to see the sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Schull
Reviews.Content: Good location roughly equidistant from Leonardo Da Vinci and Ciampino ... close to the ring motorway. Nothing remarkable or memorable ... good and attentive staff ... does what you would expect it to do ...

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: FatCockneyonTour
Reviews.Content: I was most dismayed to find a "dirty" pair of underpants hanging on the top of the heated towel rail in the bathroom. Taps and handles weren't clean and several bulbs in the room were blown. There is no excuse for this in a quality hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Choice!!”
Reviews.Author: dimitrios c
Reviews.Content: I booked it in September during my 5 days visit in Rome. After lot's of hours of walking in Rome, I enjoy a hot bath and a quiet rest in a room that is really going to be unforgetable, with trendy docoration, really luxurious, clean and convinient!!! Personell is always available to assist and hotel services are really great, including a shuttle bus every hour to the center of the city!! Try the wonderful dishes at the restaurant and drink the local wine!! I would definately visit it agian!!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: despina g
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights. Facilities, room service, staff, breakfast, shuttle bus, everything excellent!! Only the air condition was shut down during the night & it is a bit far from the centre. In general, prety good work! Keep going!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay... Place to be in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Jacob A
Reviews.Content: Been there once again. Advise it for any commercial firms. I strongly recommend a dinner at the restaurant where you can relax and enjoy roman main courses. Great to choose among different Italian wines and even if you travel alone for business, the waiter will never leave you apart. Take the opportunity to visit the downtown with a few minutes travelling thanks to the shuttle service. Great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Jacob A
Reviews.Content: I was at Midas Hotel during one of my last business trip to Rome and think I will stay again there. What impressed me the most was the quality of the rest I got; great restaurant (delicious main courses), good room (quite and defintely clean), tactical spot to get to the downtown in a few minutes and close to the main airport. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: Lionel G
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was very good. I'm not sure what some of the other reviews were about. It is undergoing dome refurbishment, but that did not effect us. The breakfast was great and the staff very helpful. Yes their first language is Italian, but this is Rome, what do people expect. That aside you could not have asked for more for the price. Hint: You can get an all day transpor ticket from the campsite across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: elizman
Reviews.Content: It is an hotel choosened by Tourism Agencies for groups. We had the bad luck to have to stay here twice. The pool purpose is only for the photo since it was out of service both times . Terraces were quite dirty with cigarretes and dust. Modern bedrooms and bathrooms. Unfriendly staff. Far from downtown or any Metro station. The Hotel shuttle is not free, subject to a schedule, without air-condition and leaves you at Piazza Cavour. Of course, we stayed in another Hotel when we returned to Rome after the tour,.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Rooms and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ThreeBells
Reviews.Content: I lead tours to Europe and just returned from a 20-day adventure. We chose this hotel because it has air conditioning and a large swimming pool. We found the rooms very nicely supplied, clean, and with enough space. However, one of my chaperones had a room that had been smoked in. Due to the hot weather, opening the windows and airing the room was not possible. We requested a new room as our stay was three nights, but were not accommodated. Additionally, the pool was not open due to what the staff called "technical problems" and was no one worked on it for the 4 days we were there. This was a huge let-down for the 27 people on my tour. The hotel offers a very convenient shuttle service to the center of Roma for only 5 Euro R/T. It was efficient and affordable. Again, however, one night when we bought our tickets at the front desk and waited outside, the bus pulled up, 24 of my 27 were standing outside, and the bus drove off. It was the first time we were to use the bus, and my participants did not know that they should have waived down the driver. We immediately notified the front desk that the bus had left us, and asked that he turn around and pick us up, as we were there at the designated departure time. This did not happen. They did run an extra run for us we believe because we waited only an extra hour, not an hour and a half as was scheduled. We knew from then on to be aggressive and get on the bus immediately. The breakfasts were good and by the end of the four day stay, the front desk became more friendly. The manager seemed to not care about our comfort during our stay, but the desk help was more helpful and friendly. Additionally, it is an easy walk to a full grocery store and McDonald's for those late-night cravings. If the pool was operational, we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't have one unique selling point”
Reviews.Author: LoungeLizardLLC
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a typical concrete/Steel construction hotel. Located on Via Aurelia, it is some way out of the city and therefore for the budding Roman explorer, is a little out of town. It is set on a hill overlooking the via Aurelia which is simply a very busy road/artery into central Rome. The view from the front rooms in uninspiring (the busy road) and from the rear just dull. On a good day it is a 20 minute road journey. At busy times a good deal longer. The hotel itself has a very tired feel. The pool is dirty and needs some care.The decor on the outside needs frshening up. Inside the lobby/reception and rooms are functional if not luxurious. In my room it was clean, tidy and worked OK. Hot water and pressure are good. The staff like any hotel vary in their Customer-service soft skills but being Rome this is a recurring theme and I don't think you can adeversely score it on this point. The restaurant is adequate but my advice is to take a cab ride and find somewhere typically Roman. The food in the hotel is not particulalry good and is a little over-priced. In summary, the hotel lacks some decent investment. It could be much better, but to be honest is a poor relation in terms of appeal compared to the Holiday Inn (which is 200 yards away) if this area and price point are what you want. But really, get further into Rome in a smaller, more intimate Hotel and let the city compensate you for the standard of Rome hotels in General. On a point to business users. When I arrived at this hotel it was to be told that there was no Internet in the rooms due to a 're-wire'. This for work is a show-stopper and I would be careful to enquire in advance if this is mandatory for your visit.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT ANY PRICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: jdsFlanders
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights for business, therefore, was not there for the sightseeing, however, was not in a great location if you were to be there for sightseeing. The hotel is in dire need of repair and cleaning. Just not a nice place to stay - old, dirty, dingy, stained carpet and quite disgusting. Would not recommend and would never stay again at any price. With all of the moderately priced hotels in Rome, there is absolutely no reason to stay with Midas.

Reviews.Title: “icky”
Reviews.Author: Lilinani
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated 30-minutes from the city center. Although there is a shuttle service, one has to plan the day ahead because the distance of the hotel from the major sites is a logistical problem. When the shuttle service used to be free, it wasn’t much of a bother but since a fee is charged nowadays, this alone is a factor not to recommend the hotel. Although the rooms are fairly large compared to most hotel rooms in Rome, they were poorly maintained. The carpet had multiple unidentifiable stains and was dusty. Do not go barefoot in the room. The bathroom needs to be re-tiled and the faucets have to be re-fitted. There were stains in the hallway carpet and mildew in some areas. The pool service is erratic depending on the season. This one saving grace of the hotel is closed for part of the year. Breakfast is standard but you would be much happier buying food from any of the food purveyors in the city. Generic bread and yogurt do nothing for the spirit. Thankfully my encounters with hotel staff were all pleasant. Perhaps because the hotel still continues to be patronized by most tour companies, the management has become complacent in terms of housekeeping. Even if the décor and furnishings are dated, the least I expect is cleanliness. Although the hotel is cheap by European standards, you really have to think if distance (and consequent expense) and filthy lodgings are worth the savings.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Vitor_BR
Reviews.Content: I just don`t know where to start. Let`s see...the hotel in general is beautiful, has a nice poll and a mild structure. Now, the staff is just horrible; they didn`t want to give information and were super rude. I even tryed to speak in italian with one of the guys in the front desk, because nobody in the hotel speak english very well... and the guy just laughed. They offer a bus to take you to one of the many "piazzas" (squares), but you have to pay for it. The location of the hotel is like far, far way from everything. Anyway, the bus never showed up, so i think that the positive aspect here is that the hotel payed a taxi to take us to the Piazza Navone (nothing to do there, btw). The breakfast is a joke, and a bad one! And you must eat there, cause there is NO other place to eat near the hotel. I recommend that you take a hammer with you to help eat the bread. And what about the bedrooms? Oh the rooms...We booked two rooms...one had a nice view of the garage (cigarettes and condoms included) and the other of a tree (no, seriously, just a tree). Rooms were old, but the bed is nice and soft. The bathroom were fine. I will never come back to that place.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Hotel I read In Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: vknoth
Reviews.Content: Checked reviews just before departing and worried I had made a mistake. . . NOT SO! Hotel was in good state of repair, won high praise from our cab driver, and room was spacious and clean. Hotel staffed helped us on more than five occassions to plan excursions, connect with busses, sight seeing, etc. Limited in English, still an excellent job. Breakfast Buffet was pricey, but one of the better ones on three week trip - even included with our room. Have stayed at 5 Star hotels and this rated a solid 4 Stars.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended - badly in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Jazziebabes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights when with colleagues on a conference. This was an overflow hotel as the conference was well attended. Customers and presentiers stayed elsewhere - staff delegates were dumped here. The hotel is very shabby, we arrived in hot temperatures on the 18th May - no air con in the rooms because it is 'too early'. I was given a smoking room at first even though I requested non-smoking. It stank, luckily for me I was early enough to get another room, other colleagues were not so lucky. The reception staff were not friendly, I don't think one of them smiled, and their English was not brilliant. The only pleasant member of staff i met was the bar man. he spoke perfect English and was a perfect host. The rooms were dirty, wallpaper peeling and carpets had seen better days and didn't smell too good. I had a room with twin beds whioch were hard and uncomfortable.The breakfast was ok - typical continental, but the plates were not replenished fast enough. With so many attending at one time they soon ran out of fruit, bread, cheese, plates, cups etc etc..... I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay..I recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bon_bon1976
Reviews.Content: We have arrived at the hotel at 11 a.m. The reception staff was very friendly and helpful and we were accommodated straight way. As requested our room was facing the park, so it was quiet. Very clean and comfortable beds. I loved the bath amenities - similar to bodyshop flavours. The hotel provides a bus shuttle to the centre, which was very convenient and cost only 5 euros return. We were happy with our choice as the hotels in the centre costed twice what we've paid. Yes, we had to travel half an hour to the centre but for people like me who live in London, this is actually a quick travel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever been!!!”
Reviews.Author: NIKH
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Rome during our Christmas holidays, but this hotel was really a bad bad bad choice!!!! The worst is that it is located too far from the city center. Definitely not a walking distance and about 1/2 hour driving distance by taxi! There is no easy access towards the hotel using the tube or the local buses! The hotel has a mini-bus but it stops on a square which is again far from the historical center, and they charge 5 euros per person! The hotel is clean but old. The rooms have balconies with nice views but they are cold because the central heating is closed during the night!!!!! Unbelievable!!!!!!! Additionally the mini bar is very expensive; we payed 3,5 euros for a little bottle of mineral water!!! Not to mention the breakfast which is really poor!! The hotel has good service, the waiter in the breakfast room is very kind and the people at the reception were very helpful to find a taxi for us whenever we needed it!

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: BoutiqueHotelFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights, and the service was awful. When I needed to call the front desk, the phone kept ringing and nobody would answer the phone, so I would have to go downstairs and talk to the front desk staff. When we got there one night after visiting some sights in the city centre, there was no parking space available for our rental vehicle because there were some buses parked using the spaces that are supposed to be for cars or vans, so I went to the front desk and complained about that arguing that the guest vehicles have priority over the buses, and that the buses should be parked on the street just outside of the premises; the staff did not care about my complaint and nothing was done about it. On the check out day, I asked the staff if my check out time could be extended for a few hours, they said "yes", but I would have to pay extra, like if the hotel was full, which I doubt; of course, I didn't want to pay extra, so I had to take my luggage out of the room and store it in one of my wife's family's rooms, as they were staying there for a few more days. In virtue of all this, I am terribly sorry, but I will have to penalize the hotel with my review. FELLOW TRAVELLERS: IF YOU ARE GOING TO ROME, DO NOT STAY AT THE NH MIDAS HOTEL, LOOK FOR OTHER BETTER CHOICES.

Reviews.Title: “Service should mean helping the guest”
Reviews.Author: Michealo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel having located it through "secret Deals" in lastminute.com. I had hoped to find a centrally located hotel but his hotel was a €20 trip from the centre city dining areas. The hotel shuttle service was adequate for visits to the Vatican area. There is no information about public transport available at the desk . We only found out that there was a train station in Aurelia by reading a guide book. The service was extremely poor and the cleaning standards were pretty basic. However the barman spoke excellent English and was the most helpful of the staff. The room was comfortable. The bed was extremely comfortable. The weather was excellent and and the bedroom was very warm at night. Because of its proximity to the dual carriage way it was very noisy when the window was opened. The AC was out of order. The bedside lamps were too dim to allow one to read in bed. This hotel is advertised as a 4 star. It probably was when it first opened but it is in need of re-decoration. There seemed to be a general lack of enthusiasm amongst the staff. We didn't have dinner in the hotel because the menu was pricy. The internet connection at €5 per 30 minutes is exorbitant. They seem to host conferences etc. and I'm surprised that delegates do not demand wifi in the rooms. There were two shops in the hotel but I never saw a customer in either. I feel that this hotel needs a new management to shake it up and make it customer friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Practical”
Reviews.Author: majk_p
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a business trip from 8 November - 15 November 2009. Other than it being a bit too far outside of the city center it was decent enough. The hotel is on a main route into Rome so the traffic can be tough, like in any other city. To get you into Rome the hotel offers a shuttle for 5 euros round trip, which isnt too bad of a deal considering there's no parking anywhere a tourist would be visiting and the driving is a bit, well, different than at least I'm used to. They're more aggressive drivers. The shuttle drops off at the Piazza Cavour, which is a 10 minute walk from the Vatican and a stopping place of all the local touist busses, making the whole city accessible. I found the staff to be quite friendly and one gentleman went out of his way to call a restaurant for us and get walking directions, menu sampler, and a reservation. He inquired about our dining experience when we returned and because we enjoyed it so much (Argentinian steak house called "Buaries", like Buenos Aries) he took his family the next night and too raved about it too. The room was clean and sizeable, the balcony was nice (though overlooking the traffic), and the breakfast was good. Yes, there were some spots of peeling wallpaper, the parking lot was littered with potholes, and the tv channels were limited, but all in all I thought it was pretty decent. Like I said, its practical...nothing fancy. Its probably not for the average tourist though given the 20-30 minute shuttle ride to the piazza. Oh, and lastly, internet access was criminally expensive at 25 euros for 3 hours. It didn't bother me since I wanted nothing to do with the net while we were there, but some in our party were upset about the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy hotel 1/2 hr from centre”
Reviews.Author: citybreaker60
Reviews.Content: Booked this through lastminute.com and then read some of the reviews on your site which made me very apprehensive. The hotel may struggle to justify 4 stars but it was clean and tidy and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Free transfer would have been nice but the service they offered for 5 euros was efficient and took us within walking distance of centre and vatican city. (NB don't go to Rome if you don't want to walk about a lot!) Similar to some of the other comments on here, we had problems with the toilet flush but this was solved with a short sharp clip to the lever.

Reviews.Title: “NH Jolly Midas Hotel The worst hotel ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: RXH
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights in Oct 2009. Reasonable facility but never saw a single smile from any member of staff. You got a feeling that they want to get rid of you as soon as possible. Plus they charge 5 euro for 30 min on using wi-fi, what a ripe off What a poor hotel! Never go there ever again

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL AT ANY PRICE.”
Reviews.Author: ROMAROUND53
Reviews.Content: This was a first trip to Rome which was somewhat spoiled by the experience of this hotel.The staff were not interested in single tourists,only coach parties .The room was of poor condition although clean.It was impossible to get a meal or breakfast as we were shunted from one restaurant to another, as each was set up for a particular tour group.The reception staff just did not want to speak to us if they could help it,even though ther were three of them on the desk at any one time.If you are travelling to Rome do not go to this hotel at any price,it is in urgent need of updating,as are some of the staff! Rome is a very beautiful city and deserves better than this!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T BOTHER”
Reviews.Author: mattyep
Reviews.Content: If you are considering this hotel don't bother. I unfortunatley chose the top secret hotel in last minute.com which turned out to be this horrible place. It is in the middle of nowhere although the hotel does put on a shuttle to Rome at 5€ per person. The staff are rude and unhelpful. This is never 4* (well maybe it was in the 1960's) decor is falling apart and very unclean. Bed sheets were not changed during our stay and towels were stained. There was a breakfast tray in the hallway outside our room which had fly's and lava growing in it. We advised reception that this needed to be cleaned but it was still there the next morning. Breakfast is very expensive. Prostitutes hanging around outside of the hotel car park. Horrible Horrible place

Reviews.Title: “middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: grabowski
Reviews.Content: stuck opposite a campsite which had the only place to eat in the area. staff very rude. first room we were given had a hole in the bathroom door and the toilet would not stop running. second room the safe did not work and the toilet would not stop flushing. very rude maintenance guy eventually fixed safe but not toilet flush. each time we went back to our room the key card had to be reset. shuttle is not free, e3, and takes at least half an hour to piaza cavour which is on the other side of the river to all the main attractions. only good thing about the hotel was the breakfast which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star? I don't think so.”
Reviews.Author: Summertime73
Reviews.Content: 4 star, more like 2-3. Wallpaper peeling from the walls, location too far away so walking around wasn't great, unless you like being near traffic. Service was mediocre. The shuttle bus which dropped us off near to town is not free; 3 euros for a return. This was suprising considering the hotel was so far away that it would have been good to have had this service for free. Hotel food, as stated on their menu; some food taken from the freezer section. Nice. Needless to say we didn't eat in. I wouldn't go back there, there's not even a kettle in the room and the hairdryer is pretty poor. There are better hotels in Rome, keep looking, but I wouldn't recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Toesinthesand1966
Reviews.Content: If you looking for a fancy hotel, this is not it. The room was adequate and had a nice balcony. Left the door opened at night and enjoyed the breeze. The shuttle service was on time and was convenient to take. I was worried about being alone and having my suitcase with me, but I had no problems. Staff at front desk helpful. Only had breakfast there and it was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Group-Tour Hotel”
Reviews.Author: renesanz
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel a couple weeks ago per our Globus Tour group, and was disappointed in it's considerable distance to downtown Roma. It was included in our tour itinterary, and we had no choice in hotels. (It was located in more of a residential area.) Thank goodness for the free shuttle bus service leaving every hour, which dropped you off at the Piazza Cavour - within walking distance of many things. Free maps provided at the front desk were also extremely helpful. Rooms were somewhat mediocre: most 4-Star Hotels (by European standards) seem to think dirty, stained carpets are O.K.. Room was good-sized by Italian standards, 2 twin beds extremely firm. Shower and bath were adequate. Breakfast basic, but plentiful. (Be wary of the "Breakfast Room Police," who asked you to leave the dining area if you weren't one of the regular patrons, but merely a group tour member!....A separate dining room with less breakfast items offered were for the group tour members.) The "nearby grocery store" turned out to actually be located down a hill below the hotel, accessible only by walking a mile or more through parking lots, an alley filled with garbage, and down a terrifying auto ramp - jumping out of the way of speeding cars and motorbikes! ...Internet access was unavailable when we were there, but expensive. This hotel caters more to conventions than tour groups, and left us with the feeling more than once that we were merely being tolerated. Thankfully we were only there a couple of nights. The hotel pool was filled with water, but was unavailable to use due to no lifeguard on duty. The best part of this hotel experience was the great (free) shuttle bus available!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: AlineMacDonald
Reviews.Content: All the staff were able to communicate well in English which was a big relief. The Hotel itself was clean and tidy, comfortable and very well organised. The free shuttle bus allowed us to have a relaxing holiday outwith the hustle of the city centre but ran constantly during the day at apprpriate times. Breakfast and Dinner were very nice and the swimming pool was great. There is a large supermarket very close to the hotel which was really useful as well. Would definately reccommend. Had a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you don't mind not being central”
Reviews.Author: Melbo77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of the way, but it offers a regular free bus in and out of central rome. Dropped you in a very easy to find place, and ran quite late into the evening, had no problems with it at all. Was quite nice to go back to a quieter area. Room was fine, we didn't spend much time in it anyway. Ate in the hotel restaurant, thought it was a bit overpriced for the amount of food you got, so ate out the rest of the time. Breakfast was fine though. We did spend one afternoon by the pool which was great as it was very hot when we went! There's a huge supermarket under the hotel (it's on a hill) on the main road. Fine for picking up water, snacks and laughing at funny product names! Was a while ago, so can't remember many details! I think we got a cheap deal on it, but i would think about staying there again if i go back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, filthy dump!”
Reviews.Author: shadrack202202
Reviews.Content: Last Visit:October 2007, I was given room #221 on 10/3/2007, the carpet looked like it had been in a barnyard, all the table tops were dirty with glass rings on them, the bathroom countertop had dirty black glass rings on it, the bath countertop at the back of the sink rim had a 1/2 inch of crud along it, the shower/tub had black mold and fungus in various places, the bathroom ceiling had stains and dirt on it, wallpaper was peeling in various parts of the room, one section near the entrance had wallpaper torn off and missing from the wall, the door to the adjoining room had damage to it and pieces torn off, the TV outlet was hanging out of the wall, the 220V outlet by the TV was missing the faceplate and the outlet was broken away from the box and hanging out, the hall and stair carpets also looked like they had been used in a barnyard. After extended complaints to management, I was moved to room 225. It was only slightly better. Looking at room 221 after I was moved, I found that they had just taken the toilet "sanitary" paper band out of the trash and put it back on the toilet and the room was ready for the next guest! Stay away!!!! What a dump !!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JanPaul044
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the facilities were good. The pool was full sized, and made a great place to go back to after a full day sight seeing.The breakfast was great, with lots of choice including eggs, bacon and sausage if required. The complimentary bus service was excellent and run at convenient times. The staff were helpful and the price was excellent for two interconnecting rooms for the children.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: aspen0
Reviews.Content: I've only been to Rome once, so I don't know if this hotel is par for the course for Rome or what, so I'm comparing it to a US Hotel, I'd give it a 2/5. We lost power twice in our room. Our AC worked but some family traveling with us didn't have working AC. The second to last day a part of our bathroom door fell off. Various places within the room had paint falling off. The fixtures were very, very old. There wasn't a dresser, not even drawers in the night stands. The mattress was far past it's lifespan, you could feel every spring coil. The shuttle was mentioned as every half hour, really its hour, and there are a few large gaps during the day when it doesn't run. It typically takes 30m to get into the city. The pool was closed for half our stay, for the other half it closed at 7:00 PM. What use is a pool that closes so early? The only reason we stayed at this hotel was because we wanted the pool as a place to cool off after a long hot day in the city. I've never been to a hotel with a pool that closed at 7. Then, half way through our trip they started doing exterior work on the hotel and completely shut down all pools & balconies, including in-room balconies. I couldn't imagine why, the work was at ground level, but whatever. Hotel staff said it'd be closed for a long time. They'd also annoyingly get pushy about where resort guests could go for meals. The bar was ridiculously overpriced with $6 cokes (I'm applying the $ to euro exchange rate). The restaurants were of course overpriced as most things in Rome, but service was good there atleast. Desk service was good as well. There was pay wifi & a small pay computer/internet cafe available. $10 euros for an hour. When so many US hotels, even cheap ones that go for less than $50 a night, offer it for free, having to pay for it is somewhat insulting. There was no fitness center. The walls were unbearably thin. You could hear ever word said in the rooms next door. The condition of the resort could best be typified by their interactive TV services. If you turn on the TV you'll watch an intro alluding to many different services. But when you go through the menus to learn more 90% it all just says "under construction." I would not stay here again, nor recommend it to others. Without the pool being open there is no good reason to stay here. You are far from everything so have to rely on the shuttle & have limited dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Not so jolly”
Reviews.Author: Shanghai52
Reviews.Content: When I walked into the hallway, I was quite surprised to see how dirty the walls and carpeting were. The room was not much better. It had a musky smell and the bedcover looked like it had not been washed for quite a while. The bathroom was very small and had mildew. Service was awful. The front desk staff made you feel like you were bothering them anytime you approached them. Location is incovenient. They advertise free shuttle but it runs only every hour or hour and a half and it drops you off near the Vatican--not the center of Rome. Food was mediocre. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worthy of 3 Stars”
Reviews.Author: missourizinger
Reviews.Content: We were booked by a travel agaent probably because the hotel offers a lot of specials. The hotel must have at some time in the past been a nice hotel. But there is no effort to maintain the upkeep of the hotel. The common hallways have shabby capets. The rooms are not maintained. The bedcover looks ancient, the air conditioning does not work properly and the bathroom equipment is as old as dirt. The toilet gushed water upward when flushed. The tub/shower had a leak and flooded the bathroom. The front desk staff was not helpful. The hotel itself is far from everything but the shuttle bus does help. So activities were centered on shuttle service or for our group of 5, we had to use 2 taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Jolly Midas - Most everything was terrible”
Reviews.Author: LeonorSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Most everything about my stay (May 30 to June 4) at the Jolly Midas in Rome was a big disappointment. The carpets are threadbare and badly stained, air conditioning was inadequate -- we had to open windows instead of depending on the AC -- and service was perfunctory at best. The hotel is classified as a 4-star property but I would give it a 2-star rating, based on my extensive travels around Europe. The hotel gave us a room with a bathroom stall that was substandard -- the stall opening was about 2 feet wide -- which we had to endure since the hotel was reportedly filled to capacity, until another room was made available. The previous night's room had a bathroom with a leaking tub; the bathroom floor was flooded considerably! The hotel is not conveniently located and requires a taxi, bus ride or shuttle service into Rome proper. The one saving grace was the dining room which served good food. I would not rcommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend for shuttle service, but not really 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: greenskye
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights in May 2007. Got ripped off by cab driver who brought us from Termini station. Meter said 15 Euros, but he charged us 40 Euros (extra due to luggage and driving at night). Should have asked for detailed receipt. Over all, nice hotel but still expensive for what you get and definitely not 4 stars. People at reception not friendly but noticed this to be the case in most of Rome. Room was small but clean except for moldy leak in corner of shower. Huge pool but was not open even though it was 30C. If you're booking for the pool, make sure to call first to find out which months the pool is open. Breakfast was a nice choice of bread and cold cuts. Best thing was the complementary shuttle bus that brings you close to the Vatican. Tips: If you're going to Vatican City, plan to go around 1pm during mid-week or you have to queue for 2 hours. Book English speaking tours on-line in advance. If you don't have a lot of luggage, take the express train for 11 Euros from Fiumicino airport to Termini station. Take metro A for 1 Euro to stop Lepanto. Walk down Via M. Colonna/Via Cicerone to Piazza Cavour (12 min). Shuttle bus stops across the street from the white church with the 2 domes where all the other tour buses stop. Find out the bus times from the hotel, first.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, great shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: Janeg26
Reviews.Content: Anyone who complains about this hotel should really be paying top price for 5star accommodation. The breakfast was fantastice with lots of choice, for the price you can't complain about anything. The shuttle service is excellent & if it wasn't for this I would say it is too far from the city, a taxi in costs about 15 euro. If you are looking for a nice place to stay at a reasonable price with access to Rome this is a great choice. My only complaint would be the bar prices are way too high.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed with Globus Tour”
Reviews.Author: davehol
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a Globus Tour Group so we did not use the Shuttle which would be helpful to most people. One of the nicer kept hotels out of the 11 we stayed in. Pool was wonderful and hugh. I thought the staff was indifferent and standoffish. Food was okay but pricey the only time we ate there. Also the exercise room advertised was nothing but a treadmill, bike (not working), and rower. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and shuttle coach service”
Reviews.Author: gezzer
Reviews.Content: Family with two teenage children stayed for 6 nights, booking independantly via Expedia. The hotel is on the outskirts of Rome and is used extensively by coach tours. Luckily they are separated for meals, so no queueing with them all at breakfast! On our first night the hotel was overrun with noisy German kids, but mostly coaches of Japanese and Greek adults after this. If the hotel did not have the pool and the shuttle coach service there would be little to recommend it for. The decor is in need of updating and the staff can appear aloof and maybe unfriendly, but I got the feeling that this is so in Rome, as somewhat similar in the city centre. With the coach service and the pool though, the hotel definitley becomes recommended. The coach service is reliable and comfortable. The driver who looked like de Niro kept us amused with his bad tempered attitude to all other drivers, but he always got us there safely, though no quicker than the other drivers who were far more relaxed! The pool is superb, large, clean, with a lifeguard and supplied towels, much better that the Holiday Inn next door has. There are not too many sunbeds though as most guests are sightseeing I never found that they were all in use. With two teenage children it was great to take the first coach into Rome at 8.15 to sightsee, come back on the noon or 3pm coach and then relax at the pool in the afternoon. We ate once at the outside barbeque restaurant and, though surprised that this was the only choice of restaurant, the grilled meat and the buffet was superb and good value. Breakfast was good, with the expected continental choice plus scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages. Good selection of fruit that they do not mind you taking out of the restaurant. One criticism is that it is not possible to order a sandwich or such simple snack at the poolside tables during the day, you can only have a meal (pasta, lasagne etc). There is though, a large supermarket in front of the hotel, plus a macdonalds and a good baguette shop witin the Agip petrol station next door. (Note: turn left from reception, past the coach parking and walk past the sliding metal gates to reach the safe Holiday Inn road that joins the highway by the Agip garage, its safer than walking from the supermarket). Overall, the hotel was good value for the price we paid, with the reliable coach service and the great pool being the features that make it a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Kids”
Reviews.Author: golfmom612
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 2006 6 nights and then a week later, 2 nights. The room was huge, air conditioning was just right, and the room was spotless. This is not to say the hotel shows some wear (carpeting) but it was an excellent value. The pool is perfect temperature and again, the lifeguards were constantly cleaning the deck chairs and sweeping leaves out of the water. The shuttle runs from 8:15 a.m. until 11:30 at night, with a break from noon until 2 p.m. The drivers are friendly and the bus was on time. We often took advantage of the 3:30 shuttle back to the hotel, took a swim, and returned on the 7 p.m. shuttle for more Rome and dinner. If you miss the last shuttle, it is about 15 euros for the trip back to the hotel. I strongly recommend this hotel to families with children, Rome is so hot, a pool is a big plus for the kids, and the shuttle ride is about 15 minutes, you are dropped off at Piazza Cavour, close by the Vatican. Behind the hotel, just down a hill is a supermarket/Walmart type of store where you can get anything you forgot at a good price. Buffet breakfast was eggs, bacon, sausage, deli meats, fruits, pastries, a good start to the day. We booked on Expedia and paid $86 U.S. dollars night. They offer adjoining rooms also.

Reviews.Title: “one night stay”
Reviews.Author: matchpoint
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on our last night of an eight day Globus tour. This is a typical hotel found in the USA Nothing special. Complimentary Bus shuttle service every hour to and from Rome central was a plus. takes about 20 minutes - depending on traffic. Needs updating. Breakfast too crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight in July 2005. Positives: Beautiful hotel with high quality furnishings and fittings. The pool is a god send in hot weather - very refreshing. Towells provided by the pool. Beds comfortable. Good air conditioning. Very clean bathroom with bidet. Staff were friendly and helpful and spoke English reasonably well. Shuttle service was handy to take you to Piazza Cavour and taxis were cheap enough to get around in. Very close to McDonalds (down the back hill) and other fast food convenience. Breakfast was more than adequate with everything you could possibly want including bacon, eggs, pastries etc. Negatives: The location is a little distant from the sights of Rome but the shuttle service does help to combat this problem. Bar menu wasn't all that great - could have been improved. Overall a great hotel which I would highly recommend if you dont want to be among the hustle and bustle of Rome - lovely quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Good and spacious hotel; location a problem”
Reviews.Author: Magic_Carpet_Ride
Reviews.Content: It is good hotel with spacious rooms and a lot of internal and external space. It has a large pool with gardens all around. The rooms are comfortable with good sized balconies. We had one with a pool view; a pretty sight at night. The location is a problem though; it is located a little outside the main city and away from the attractions. Rome does not have a good transport system and getting to the hotel and out by public transport is a challenge. The hotel does have a free shuttle service to a central point in the city every half hour until about 10 p.m. and that is very useful. We made extensive use of the shuttle. The hotel was used by the players during the Italian Soccer World Cup. The decor is a little dated and could do with refurbishment. However, we had a good deal from lastminute and the service and space was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “jolly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the on-line reviews we were a little unsure what to expect from this hotel. However, or fears were unfounded, the rooms were excellent, the pool was open, the staff were very friendly and the location didn't matter as the hotel provided an excellent free bus service to the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel, poor location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day vecation in the MIDAS hotel, Rome 2-5/06/2005. The Midas Hotel is a comfortable hotel with a modern structure. The amenities include air-conditioning, bar, business centre, beauty parlour, cable TV (mostly Italian), car parking, a cash machine in the lobby and more. The guest rooms are comfortable and nicely equipped to give a feeling of being home. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful (good enough English). This hotel is not located in the center of Rome (which is why I didn't rated it 5) but they do provide a free shuttle to Piazza Cavour (about 30 min-depending of traffic), which is about 15-20 min. walk to the Vatican, or to the Spanish Steps - across the bridge. The shuttle runs hourly more or less ,from 08:15 until 23:00 (In the afternoon every 2 hours). In the 4 days that we stayed in the hotel, the bus was was available and reliable. except one time, when it had some mechanial problems, and the service was canceled for a few hours. It could happens anywere. Consider this. If you missed the bus it was still only about 10-12 euros to come back in a taxi. The rooms are quite big relative to the hotels located in the center of the city. Our room was very nice and clean (including the bathroom!!). There is not much close to the hotel. You can find a large supermarket, where you can buy hot pizza by the slice to-go or a good Italian cofee to take back home. You get there by turning left as you leave the hotel and walking down the stairway. You will also see a road leading over to another hotel. After reaching the main road downsters, walk to the left. If you walk to the right you will find McDonalds and a sub sandwich shop. We also ate dinner at the hotel. Excellent service, reasonably priced (including complimentary champagne). Our deal included a complimentary breakfast, good food and coffe !(espresso maciato, cappuccino etc.) The breakfast was very rich, relative to others 4+ hotels, in Europe. The pool looked lovely, but it was still closed during the begining of June (... it was about 27 deg. cel. outside). We paid about $200 per night for a room. And it worth it ! (especially if my wife said that it met her standerds). Overall I would say this is a very recomanded hotel, if you mange to accept the use of a shuttel to reach the center of Rome, and the cost of a taxi from the airport to the MIDAS (about 30 - 40 Euro, for about 30 min drive). If you rent a car, it wouldn't be an issue for you.

Reviews.Title: “What? No pool open”
Reviews.Author: Mustgo
Reviews.Content: Arrived after midnight on Tuesday 31 May 2005. Taxi from Ciampino airport cost 49 euros. I thought it would be easy to barter but there were few unbooked taxis. Add these costs onto your seemingly cheap flights. Hotel reception desk staff were all efficient and pleasant. The comfortable double room on the fourth floor, overlooking the empty swimming pool, was very clean though the bath looked cracked, it was in fact fine. The air conditioning was an advantage as Rome temperatures are too uncomfortable not to have. The bed was huge and because the hotel was set back from a busy road, the noise was minimal, though Rome ambulances make such a racket that no hotel anywhere could hide their sirens. We gave up trying to work out how to use the credit card pass safe but we would have asked if we really wanted to. There was a keyboard for internet access facility in the room. The dining room was quiet. The breakfast included cereals, fruits, yoghurts, and the usual continental pastries though none looked exciting. The 'English' breakfast area had a heated covered tray with small tasty sausuages, scrambled egg, bacon and a toast making machine. Replacing the lid kept the contents warm enough. No frills just basic. Each evening we returned at midnight after catching the last shuttle, to find only a few customers in the bar, however the pianist still played when there was no one there. We sat outside on the veranda wondering how many people were staying here. Coaches parked up indicated that there were more than 20 in the hotel, yet in our entire stay we never saw more than that amount. By finding this website for the first time, the day before I travelled, I'd read a review that the swimming pool was not open. The pool was the factor for booking. It should be opened in another week but the reception desk staff was vague on the actual date. The shuttle bus is a must. The hotel is situated above two busy roads and it wasn't safe to go for a walk. There is a supermarket at the foot of the hotel but looked impossible to access without transport. Make sure you have a timetable of the punctual clean efficient shuttle coachbus as we forgot to take ours on the last day and had to get a taxi back from the pick up point Piazza Cavour at 1pm as the shuttle has a three hour break in the afternoon. We shared a taxi back to the Jolly Midas with another couple who hadn't read their timetable either. However it cost only 13 euros and they insisted on paying. Reading the tariff charges displayed in the back of the taxi , we discovered it is like England, much more expensive on an evening or once you are outside the city walls the price increases. If you have luggage there is a fee per piece. Next time, because there will most definitely be a return to Rome, I will take recommendation from Travel Advisors members reports and stay where its possible to return easily to our hotel for a wash and change before going out for the evening. I recommend a stay in the Jolly Midas if you want a comfortable, quiet hotel with a relaxed ambience and with a swimming pool...but check its open. Don't stay if you hate being dependant on buses or you want a party atmosphere. Mustgo 4th June 2005

Reviews.Title: “Vincenzo is a treasure!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from three nights in the Jolly Midas with four other people. Generally, we had a good stay in this hotel. We found the breakfasts very good and plenty of choice, the piano bar was very relaxing and Vincenzo was the perfect barman bringing little bowls of snacks to our table to help the drinks go down. The reception staff were very helpful, even when one member of our party had repeated problems with the door lock. The reliable shuttle bus ran from 8.15 in the morning 'til 11.30 at night. If you missed the bus it was still only about 10 euros for the five of us to come back in a taxi. We'd booked this hotel because it had a beautiful swimming pool and had planned to spend the last day chilling out round the pool before flying home on the evening. Unfortunately, we hadn't been told when booking the hotel (only a couple of weeks before we travelled) that the pool was drained and being re-landscaped. This was the only disappointing note in a very nice stay. We would certainly consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Jolly...' good '”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the jolly hotel midas in march 2005 .Our stay there could not have been more pleasant.we were a party of three people and had two rooms which were very pleasant and clean although if i could mention that the decor needs updating a little tired perhaps....dont like to moan but I am sure you like these matters brought to your attention.The reception staff were very friendly and helpful also the courtesy hotel bus was excellent and only took about 15 to 20 minutes into city centre, perhaps this would be longer in the busier summer months but we were very pleased it was available and reliable .I would like to mention the bar service we received in the piano bar at evening time,the barman was so lovely to us bringing nuts and crisps with drink orders and served toasted sandwiches until late in the evening.we were very impressed with the manner we were treated,he wass a real professional he really seemed to enjoy his job,a great asset to the hotel.we enjoyed our evening meals with equally pleasant staff and were able to have steak and chips no problem just like at home [Ireland] if you have a preferance for well done learn the italian as it will be served quite rare.We would love to be going back there right now and we hope to get the chance again next year and if we could mention the lovely ladies who look after the rooms top marks for friendliness and cleanliness .Well worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Butterfly”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I plus 2 other of our friends stayed in Jolly Midas in Rome and were very pleased. We stayed there for 5 nights Including the New Years night and found that we had a good deal. I would give this hotel 5 stars, if the location would be in the centre of Rome. We rented a car upon our arrival to safe money on taxis and be more flexible. The breakfast was good, too.
